document.title: K-12 PE Standards May 2017 Michigan Department of Education

C5F26656A1A34DE492DE2C8D12366181.description:
Level 2: Evaluates the opportunity for social interaction and social support in a
self-selected physical activity or dance.S5.4.L2

A54670CFDAFA4296B52391720B7928C9.description:
Level 1: Identifies the opportunity for social support in a self-selected physical
activity or dance. S5.4.L1

2563174FD24B4A32961C66B944591E56.description: Level 2: Identifies the uniqueness of creative dance as a means of self expression.

149940DB4C324C1B8F64956FAABA23F3.description:
Level 1: Selects and participates in physical activities or dance that meet the
need for self-expression and enjoyment. S5.3.L1

DC67FB486E6A47BBB7E67A680C6E857E.description:
Level 2: Chooses an appropriate level of challenge to experience success and
desire to participate in a self-selected physical activity.

7BF08AA19FB347ABB66CE14A8205E5F7.description: Challenge is a focus in Level 2

AC4125A3C3784FB79E3A1B3DBD102790.description:
Level 2: If the outcome was not achieved in Level 1, it should be a focus in
Level 2. S5.1.L2

67C2B3D881E54B79A954FFCC2A1325CF.description: Level 1: Analyzes the health benefits of a self-selected physical activity. S5.1.L1

FA36E75EC89A4A3BB7A4536307C7C48B.description:
Standard 5: Recognizes the value of physical activity for health, enjoyment, challenge, self-expression and/or
social interaction.

1E382A4A27A742119225E9837E380263.description:
Level 2: If the outcome was not achieved in Level 1, it should be a focus in
Level 2. S4.5.L2

8CCB5E6968024350B8C178BA7FB72AE0.description:
Level 1: Applies best practices for participating safely in physical activity,
exercise and dance (e.g. injury prevention, proper alignment,
hydration, use of equipment, implementation of rules, sun protection).

9E8322BAE47F49FF855533FA46FAEA88.description:
Level 2: Accepts others’ ideas, cultural diversity, and body types by engaging in
cooperative and collaborative movement projects. S4.4.L2

1E2E2CB7E3F240049EEC901B3D5DAD61.description:
Level 1: Solves problems and thinks critically in physical activity or dance
settings, both as an individual and in groups. S4.4.L1

D4E0116382B848E497F6759D10A6BBDB.description:
Level 2: Assumes a leadership role (e.g. task or group leader, referee, coach) in
a physical activity setting. S4.3.L2

B6D72728933B468DA1951812FF150DB1.description:
Level 1: Uses communication skills and strategies that promote team or group
dynamics. S4.3.L1

17E10BCBC5E0410FBE879FC05095CF98.description:
Level 2: Examines moral and ethical conduct in specific competitive situations
(e.g. intentional fouls, performance-enhancing substances, gambling,
current events in sport). S4.2.L2

9362F07CCAC242BBA3FD4F78F3F79830.description:
Level 1: Exhibits proper etiquette, respect for others, and teamwork while
engaging in physical activity and/or social dance. S4.2.L1

EF16D56505A140638122A6AFEF0D0740.description:
Level 2: Accepts differences between personal characteristics and the idealized
body images and elite performance levels portrayed in various media. S4.1.L2

6886C947F1674DBFB547966C2B3A7EE6.description:
Level 1: Employs effective self-management skills to analyze barriers and
modify physical activity patterns appropriately as needed. S4.1.L1

A7A56085058C44619E7903B0B17AF954.description: Standard 4: Exhibits responsible personal and social behavior that respects self and others.

C42844E0603D4DDCB51D9AB2C3813C21.description:
Level 2: Applies stress-management strategies (e.g. mental imagery, relaxation
techniques, deep breathing, aerobic exercise, and meditation) to
reduce stress. S3.14.L2

E72A1195A07B499CB8DA5CFCA4E31939.description:
Level 1: Identifies stress-management strategies (e.g. mental imagery,
relaxation techniques, deep breathing, aerobic exercise, and
meditation) to reduce stress. S3.14.L1

B2A686C02FAF42A1A46B205D8DB083C4.description:
Level 2: Creates a snack plan for before, during, and after exercise that
addresses nutrition needs for each phase. S3.13.L2

FE37555589CF400AAA1F29E811F34071.description:
Level 1: Designs and implements a nutrition plan to maintain an appropriate
energy balance for a healthy, active lifestyle. S3.13.L1

E3998CBF9302414AA157CF1A62E40F32.description:
Level 2: Analyzes the components of skill-related fitness in relation to life and
career goals and designs an appropriate fitness program for those
goals. S3.12.L2

3BAB333D586049AF9032964454BC3C48.description:
Level 1: Designs a fitness program, including all components of health-related
fitness, for a college student and an employee in the learner’s chosen
field of work.

F94FD892F9C94E2286013F4D01C70329.description:
Level 2: Develops and maintains a fitness portfolio (e.g. assessment scores,
goals for improvement, plan of activities for improvement, log of
activities being done to reach goals, timeline for improvement). S3.11.L2

25198A5D787243D8B7CD37B5D318637F.description:
Level 1: Creates and implements a behavior-modification plan that enhances
a healthy, active lifestyle in college or career settings. S3.11.L1

2CCFA6F77DD14E3CB4BF0ABA013E330E.description:
Level 2: Adjusts pacing to keep heart rate in the target zone, using available
technology (e.g. pedometer, heart rate monitor), to self-monitor aerobic
intensity. S3.10.L2

12E265550ED74905A840FD2CC15A92FA.description:
Level 1: Calculates target heart rate and applies that information to personal
fitness plan. S3.10.L1

3826CEBDC3BD4486A92729CA614D7971.description:
Level 2: Identifies the structure of skeletal muscle and fiber types as they relate
to muscle development. S3.9.L1

9F56EB96D66C427FADA621033869A709.description:
Level 1: Identifies types of strength exercises (isometric, concentric, eccentric)
and stretching exercises (static, proprioceptive neuromuscular
facilitation (PNF), dynamic) for personal fitness development (e.g.
strength, endurance, range of motion). S3.9.L1

87B800558D2A4919962885ABC4A7221F.description:
Level 2: Identifies the different energy systems used in a selected physical
activity (e.g. adenosine triphosphate and phosphocreatine, anaerobic
glycolysis, aerobic). S3.8.L2

5902BA2D406740D4BA3EA946436DA5BA.description:
Level 1: Relates physiological responses to individual levels of fitness and
nutritional balance. S3.8.L1

44BE3B2408924D8EA28FC344C21AFF11.description:
Level 2: Designs and implements a strength and conditioning program that
develops balance in opposing muscle groups (agonist-antagonist) and
supports a healthy, active lifestyle. S3.7.L2

7B1077677F6940349690F35A9263778A.description:
Level 1: Demonstrates appropriate technique in resistance-training machines
and free-weights. S3.7.L1

A78CAF02C3C243558E34723CFC3AA706.description:
Level 2: Creates a plan, trains for, and participates in a community event with a
focus on physical activity (e.g. 5K, triathlon, tournament, dance
performance, cycling event). S3.6.L2

60CF531DC3D242A999D9DC2E37FACE65.description:
Level 1: Participates several times a week in a self-selected lifetime activity,
dance or fitness activity outside of the school day.S3.6.L1

6E522B9FB9F84EA0BE99B97EC7468108.description:
Level 2: Analyzes the impact of life choices, economics, motivation, and
accessibility on exercise adherence and participation in physical activity
in college or career settings. S3.5.L2

6433B31EFA7D451D9F9D38EF2B2712D4.description:
Level 1: Evaluates risks and safety factors that might affect physical activity
preferences throughout the life cycle. S3.5.L1

3697047D3C644B078F936789A6DFA95D.description:
Level 2: If the outcome was not achieved in Level 1, it should be a focus in
Level 2.

77EF6527AAAD41088F05C22D7E4CEBA7.description:
Level 1: Evaluates – according to their benefits, social support network, and
participation requirements – activities that can be pursued in the local
environment. S3.4.L1

FFE3831E3C7E4224AE98FF1E07AEE084.description: Level 2: Applies rates of perceived exertion and pacing.

D2E70579F7964185834638DE24869F3B.description:
Level 1: Identifies issues associated with exercising in heat, humidity, and
cold.

CA08ED14808348F18915C589F5417F02.description:
Level 2: Analyzes and applies technology and social media as tools for
supporting a healthy, active lifestyle.

A1F9830341384F5CAE92223FE9143927.description:
Level 1: Evaluates the validity of claims made by commercial products and
programs pertaining to fitness and a healthy, active lifestyle.

03BD8FFEE179463CA387CBABE8DCA3FE.description:
Level 2: Investigates the relationships among physical activity, nutrition, and
body composition.

B66F3234213B4ADEB248B22856CD5719.description:
Level 1:Discusses the benefits of a physical activity active lifestyle as it
relates to college or career productivity.

78B5143AEC8C4DDAB3E7F5C12B4ADD0F.description:
Standard 3: Demonstrates the knowledge and skills to achieve a health-enhancing level of physical activity and
fitness.

9501D70B366144A6ADCE7072E238DA94.description: Level 2: Compares similarities and difference in various dance forms. (S2.4.L2

62CC03C067214F4E81A5A97DDD596E19.description: Level 1: Identifies examples of social and technical dance forms.

85EEE07DDE7E47F0B4BD83315FBFD02E.description: Level 2: Identifies the stages of learning a motor skill.

721A99D5AE654BA79029C47849D9CAA1.description:
Level 1: Creates a practice plan to improve performance for a self-selected
skill

42170DEA8AD342E4A7C011BF27AB582D.description: Level 2: Describes the speed/accuracy trade-off in throwing and striking skills.

4D42313EEC4C4D76B4F5D35248F7C562.description:
Level 1: Uses movement concepts and principles (e.g. force, motion, rotation)
to analyze and improve performance of self and/or others in a
selected skill.

1B631AEB1EBD421CBE6D0E036FC950B9.description:
Level 2: Identifies and discusses the historical and cultural roles of games,
sports, and dance in a society.

083E97891CF4476DBEED450D9A9F679C.description:
Level 1: Applies the terminology associated with exercise and participation in
selected individual-performance activities, dance, net/wall games,
target games, aquatics, and/or outdoor pursuits appropriately

50DA61A84B5145428F4EDEC98229E234.description:
Standard 2: Applies knowledge of concepts, principals, strategies and tactics related to movement and
performance.

1FA6559D8A7A47FC99CDB2C65E152308.description: Level 2: Demonstrates competency in 2 or more specialized skills in health related fitness activities.

E9FD3E92826C44B8862A127610E82C0E.description: Level 1: Demonstrates competency in 1 or more specialized skills in health related fitness activities

797BD959D0AB4FFE833B985EC5761DED.description:
Level 2: Demonstrates competency in a form of dance by choreographing a
dance or by giving a performance.

9F98518AF6B545FD806BD6DCF72E731D.description:
Level 1: Demonstrates competency in dance forms used in cultural and social
occasions (e.g. weddings, parties) or demonstrates competency in 1
form of dance (e.g. ballet, modern, hip hop, tap).

4AB4B912409E4174875271E8C4DB3F40.description:
Level 2: Refines activity-specific movement skills in 1 or more lifetime activities
(outdoor pursuits, individual-performance activities, aquatics, net/wall
games, or target games).

C4520D045A7C4899A549EFCE32748650.description:
Level 1 :Demonstrates competency and/or refines activity-specific movement
skills in 2 or more lifetime activities (outdoor pursuits, individual performance activities, aquatics, net/wall games, or target games).

64436053F1DA4BB99CB688452706BC30.description: Standard 1: Demonstrates competency in a variety of motor skills and movement patterns.
